to clear fix everything there's a bunch more container divs having to be used

anymore I mean who actually likes doing maths reduce the number of media queries
we needed to use and we were finally able to Center content vertically
something we hadn't been able to do since tables we were finally starting to
get the functionality that we needed out of our CSS we no longer needed to write
complicated code or to work with percentages and our code was now more responsive than ever
but although flexbox was really good for flowing content there was limited
control in the cross access and having gaps between items tended to get
complicated you often needed to use negative margins but things were looking up we finally
had a CSS technology that was actually built for layout and in the distance we
could see the cavalry was on its way in 2017 CSS grid launched in all new major
browsers this finally gave us everything we'd been asking for for CSS layouts
like flexbox we were able to define a set of constraints and have the browser
make the layout responsive but we were now able to control our layout in both
directions it's with grid we're able to define areas of our layout we're able to define
whether specific element should span multiple grid sections we could dictate
how the elements inside a grid behaved we could reduce the code we were writing
and even better we could reduce the thinking needed to make the layout responsive but the question everyone
keeps asking is didn't we already have this with tables isn't great just a
newer fancier version of the table layout we've been scuffing up for years
no CSS grid is specifically designed for
creating layouts it's designed for this use rather than tables which we just
used as a hack with the again this is back to following the separation of
concerns principles where CSS is where we're defining how the layout how the
page lays out in saying that tables do still have a place but that's for
tabular data or anything you would expect to see in a table CSS grid also
helps us get back to writing logical and semantic HTML we're no longer required
to write our HTML based on how the page design looks we know long we can now
write our HTML based on the logical flow of the document and let the CSS arrange
it visually where we need to when this is done right this means that our content can now be more accessible for
